   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% There are some environment variables that can be used to "manipulate"
   22: %% the test suite: 
   23: %%
   24: %% Variable that controls which 'groups' are to run (with default values)
   25: %%
   26: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_COUNTERS:   include
   27: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_CHUNKS:     include
   28: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_PING_PONG:  include
   29: %%
   30: %% Variable that controls "verbosity" of the test case(s):
   31: %%
   32: %%         ESOCK_TEST_QUIET: true (default) | false
   33: %%
   34: 
   35: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   36: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]).
   37: %%
   38: %% Run a specific group:
   39: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   40: %%
   41: %% Run a specific test case:
   42: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   43: %%
   44: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   45: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   46: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   47: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   48: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}]) end.
   49: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   50: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   51: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   52: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   53: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   54: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   55: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   56: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   57: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   58: %%
   59: %% Some official info about AF_UNIX
   60: %% https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/windowswsl-interop-with-af_unix/
   61: 
   62: 
   63: 
   64: -module(socket_traffic_SUITE).
   65: 
   66: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   67: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   68: -include("socket_test_evaluator.hrl").
   69: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   70: 
   71: %% Suite exports
   72: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   73: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   74:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   75:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   76:

  155: -define(KLIB,       kernel_test_lib).
  156: -define(LOGGER,     socket_test_logger).

  158: -define(DATA,       <<"HOPPSAN">>). % Temporary
  159: -define(FAIL(R),    exit(R)).
  160: 
  161: -define(TPP_SMALL,  lists:seq(1, 8)).
  162: -define(TPP_MEDIUM, lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(100, ?TPP_SMALL))).
  163: -define(TPP_LARGE,  lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(100, ?TPP_MEDIUM))).
  164: 
  165: -define(TPP_SMALL_NUM,  5000).
  166: -define(TPP_MEDIUM_NUM, 500).
  167: -define(TPP_LARGE_NUM,  50).
  168: -define(TPP_NUM(Config, Base), (Base) div lookup(kernel_factor, 1, Config)).

  171: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  172: 
  173: suite() ->
  174:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
  175:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
  176: 
  177: all() -> 
  178:     Groups = [{counters,  "ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_COUNTERS",  include},
  179:               {chunks,    "ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_CHUNKS",    include},
  180:               {ping_pong, "ESOCK_TEST_TRAFFIC_PING_PONG", include}],
  181:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
  182: 
  183: use_group(_Group, undefined, exclude) ->
  184:     [];
  185: use_group(Group, undefined, _Default) ->
  186:     [{group, Group}];
  187: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
  188: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
  189: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
  190: 		[{group, Group}];
  191: 	    false ->
  192: 		[];
  193: 	    Val ->
  194: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  195: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  196: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  197: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  198: 			[{group, Group}];
  199: 		    _ ->
  200: 			[]
  201: 		end
  202: 	end.
  203:     
  204: 
  205: groups() -> 
  206:     [{counters,            [], traffic_counters_cases()},
  207:      {chunks,              [], traffic_chunks_cases()},
  208:      {ping_pong,           [], traffic_ping_pong_cases()},
  209:      {pp_send_recv,        [], traffic_pp_send_recv_cases()},
  210:      {pp_sendto_recvfrom,  [], traffic_pp_sendto_recvfrom_cases()},
  211:      {pp_sendmsg_recvmsg,  [], traffic_pp_sendmsg_recvmsg_cases()}
  212:     ].
  213:

  309: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  310:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  311:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  312:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  313:     
  314:     try socket:info() of
  315:         #{} ->
  316:             case ?KLIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  317:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  318:                     SKIP;
  319: 
  320:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  321: 
  322:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  323:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  324: 
  325:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
  326:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  327: 
  328:                     socket:use_registry(false),
  329:                     case quiet_mode(Config1) of
  330:                         default ->
  331:                             case ?LOGGER:start() of
  332:                                 ok ->
  333:                                     Config1;
  334:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  335:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  336:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  337:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  338:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  339:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  340:                             end;
  341:                         Quiet ->
  342:                             case ?LOGGER:start(Quiet) of
  343:                                 ok ->
  344:                                     [{esock_test_quiet, Quiet} | Config1];
  345:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  346:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  347:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  348:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  349:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  350:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  351:                             end
  352:                     end
  353:             end
  354:     catch
  355:         error : notsup ->
  356:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  357:         error : undef ->
  358:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  359:     end.
  360: 
  361: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  362: 
  363:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  364:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  365:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  366: 
  367:     %% Stop the local monitor
  368:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  369: 
  370:     (catch ?LOGGER:stop()),
  371: 
  372:     Config1 = ?KLIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  373: 
  374:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  375:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  376: 
  377:     Config1.
  378: 
  379: 
  380: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  381:     Config.
  382: 
  383: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  384:     Config.
  385: 
  386: 
  387: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  388:     io:format("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
  389:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  390:               "~n", [_TC, Config]),
  391:     Config.
  392: 
  393: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  394:     Config.
  395: 
  396: 
  397: quiet_mode(Config) ->
  398:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_quiet, 1, Config) of
  399:         {value, {esock_test_quiet, Quiet}} ->
  400:             Quiet;
  401:         false ->
  402:             case os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_QUIET") of
  403:                 "true"  -> true;
  404:                 "false" -> false;
  405:                 _       -> default
  406:             end
  407:     end.
  408: 
  409: 
  410: 
  411: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  412: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  413: %% for both read and write.
  414: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  415: %% We use TCP on IPv4.
  416: 
  417: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  418:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  419:     tc_try(traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp4,
  420:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
  421:            fun() ->
  422:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
  423:                                  proto  => tcp,
  424:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  425:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  426:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  427:            end).
  428: 
  429: 
  430: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  431: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  432: %% for both read and write.
  433: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  434: %% We use TCP on IPv6.
  435: 
  436: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  437:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  438:     tc_try(traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcp6,
  439:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
  440:            fun() ->
  441:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
  442:                                  proto  => tcp,
  443:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  444:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  445:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  446:            end).
  447: 
  448: 
  449: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  450: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  451: %% for both read and write.
  452: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  453: %% We use default (TCP) on local.
  454: 
  455: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  456:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  457:     tc_try(traffic_send_and_recv_counters_tcpL,
  458:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
  459:            fun() ->
  460:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
  461:                                  proto  => default,
  462:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  463:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  464:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  465:            end).
  466: 
  467: 
  468: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  469: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test that the counters
  470: %% for both read and write.
  471: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
  472: %% We use SCTP on IPv4.
  473: 
  474: traffic_send_and_recv_counters_sctp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  475:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
  476:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  477:            fun() ->
  478:                    is_not_flakey_os(),
  479:                    has_support_ipv4(),
  480:                    has_support_sctp()
  481:            end,
  482:            fun() ->
  483:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
  484:                                  proto  => sctp,
  485:                                  recv   => fun(S)    -> socket:recv(S)    end,
  486:                                  send   => fun(S, D) -> socket:send(S, D) end},
  487:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  488:            end).
  489: 
  490:

  523:            fun() ->
  524:                    is_not_windows(),
  525:                    has_support_ipv4()
  526:            end,
  527:            fun() ->
  528:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
  529:                                  proto  => tcp,
  530:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
  531:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of
  532:                                                        {ok, #{iov  := [Data]}} ->
  533:                                                            {ok, Data};
  534:                                                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
  535:                                                            ERROR
  536:                                                    end
  537:                                            end,
  538:                                  send   => fun(S, Data) ->
  539:                                                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},
  540:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)
  541:                                            end},
  542:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
  543:            end).

  587:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
  588:            fun() ->
  589:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
  590:                                  proto  => default,
  591:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->

  596:                                                            ERROR
  597:                                                    end

  599:                                  send   => fun(S, Data) ->
  600:                                                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},
  601:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)

  618:                    is_not_windows(),

  621:            end,

  623:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,

  626:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of

  650:            fun() ->
  651:                    is_not_flakey_os(),
  652:                    is_not_windows(),
  653:                    has_support_ipv6(),
  654:                    has_support_sctp()
  655:            end,

  657:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
  658:                                  proto  => sctp,
  659:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
  660:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of
  661:                                                        {ok, #{iov  := [Data]}} ->
  662:                                                            {ok, Data};
  663:                                                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
  664:                                                            ERROR
  665:                                                    end
  666:                                            end,

  668:                                                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},

  672:            end).
  673: 
  674: 
  675: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  676: 
  677: traffic_send_and_recv_stream(InitState) ->
  678:     ServerSeq =
  679:         [
  680:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
  681:          #{desc => "await start",
  682:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
  683:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
  684:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
  685:                    end},
  686:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
  687:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  688:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
  689:                            ok
  690:                    end},
  691: 
  692:          %% *** Init part ***
  693:          #{desc => "which local address",
  694:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
  695:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
  696:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
  697:                    end},
  698:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
  699:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
  700:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
  701:                                {ok, Sock} ->
  702:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
  703:                                {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
  704:                                    {skip, Reason};
  705:                                {error, eprotonosupport = Reason} ->
  706:                                    {skip, Reason};
  707:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  708:                                    ERROR
  709:                            end
  710:                    end},
  711:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
  712:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
  713:                          lsock    := LSock,
  714:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
  715:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
  716:                                ok ->
  717:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
  718:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  719:                                    ERROR
  720:                            end;
  721:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
  722:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
  723:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
  724:                                ok ->
  725:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
  726:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
  727:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  728:                                    ERROR
  729:                            end
  730:                    end},
  731:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
  732:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
  733:                            socket:listen(LSock)
  734:                    end},
  735:          #{desc => "initial (listen socket) counter validation (=zero)",
  736:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = _State) ->
  737:                            try socket:info(LSock) of
  738:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  739:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial listen socket counters: "
  740:                                                "~s", [format_counters(listen,
  741:                                                                       Counters)]),
  742:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
  743:                            catch
  744:                                C:E:S ->
  745:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  746:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  747:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  748:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  749:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  750:                            end
  751:                    end},
  752:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
  753:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
  754:                          tester   := Tester,
  755:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}}) ->
  756:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
  757:                            ok;
  758:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
  759:                          lport    := Port}) ->
  760:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
  761:                            ok
  762:                    end},
  763: 
  764:          %% The actual test
  765:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
  766:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  767:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
  768:                    end},
  769:          #{desc => "accept",
  770:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
  771:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
  772:                                {ok, CSock} ->
  773:                                    #{counters := LCnts} = socket:info(LSock),
  774:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate listen counters: "
  775:                                                "~s", [format_counters(listen,
  776:                                                                       LCnts)]),
  777:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  778:                                      LCnts,
  779:                                      [{acc_success, 1},
  780:                                       {acc_fails,   0},
  781:                                       {acc_tries,   1},
  782:                                       {acc_waits,   0}]),
  783:                                    #{counters := CCnts} = socket:info(CSock),
  784:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial accept counters: "
  785:                                                "~s", [format_counters(CCnts)]),
  786:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(CCnts),
  787:                                    {ok, State#{csock => CSock}};
  788:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  789:                                    ERROR
  790:                            end
  791:                    end},
  792:          #{desc => "initial counter validation (=zero)",
  793:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = _State) ->
  794:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  795:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  796:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial counters: "
  797:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  798:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
  799:                            catch
  800:                                C:E:S ->
  801:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  802:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  803:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  804:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  805:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  806:                            end
  807:                    end},
  808:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
  809:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  810:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
  811:                            ok
  812:                    end},
  813: 
  814:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
  815:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  816:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
  817:                    end},
  818:          #{desc => "recv (1)",
  819:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock,
  820:                          recv  := Recv} = State) ->
  821:                            case Recv(Sock) of
  822:                                {ok, Data} ->
  823:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  824:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => 1,
  825:                                                read_byte => size(Data)}};
  826:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  827:                                    ERROR
  828:                            end
  829:                    end},
  830:          #{desc => "validate (recv 1)",
  831:            cmd  => fun(#{csock     := Sock,
  832:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
  833:                          read_byte := Byte} = _State) ->
  834:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  835:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  836:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  837:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  838:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  839:                                      Counters,
  840:                                      [{read_pkg,     Pkg},
  841:                                       {read_byte,    Byte},
  842:                                       {read_tries,   any},
  843:                                       {read_pkg_max, any}])
  844:                            catch
  845:                                C:E:S ->
  846:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  847:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  848:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  849:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  850:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  851:                            end
  852:                    end},
  853:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
  854:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  855:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
  856:                            ok
  857:                    end},
  858: 
  859:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 1)",
  860:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  861:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
  862:                    end},
  863:          #{desc => "send (1)",
  864:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock,
  865:                          send  := Send} = State) ->
  866:                            Data = ?DATA,
  867:                            case Send(Sock, Data) of
  868:                                ok ->
  869:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  870:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => 1,
  871:                                                write_byte => size(Data)}};
  872:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  873:                                    ERROR
  874:                            end
  875:                    end},
  876:          #{desc => "validate (send 1)",
  877:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  878:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
  879:                          read_byte  := RByte,
  880:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
  881:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
  882:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  883:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  884:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  885:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  886:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  887:                                      Counters,
  888:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
  889:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
  890:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
  891:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
  892:                                       {read_tries,    any},
  893:                                       {write_tries,   any},
  894:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
  895:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
  896:                            catch
  897:                                C:E:S ->
  898:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  899:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  900:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  901:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  902:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  903:                            end
  904:                    end},
  905:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 1)",
  906:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  907:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
  908:                            ok
  909:                    end},
  910: 
  911:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
  912:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  913:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
  914:                    end},
  915:          #{desc => "recv (2)",
  916:            cmd  => fun(#{csock     := Sock,
  917:                          recv      := Recv,
  918:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
  919:                          read_byte := Byte} = State) ->
  920:                            case Recv(Sock) of
  921:                                {ok, Data} ->
  922:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  923:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
  924:                                                read_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
  925:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  926:                                    ERROR
  927:                            end
  928:                    end},
  929:          #{desc => "validate (recv 2)",
  930:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  931:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
  932:                          read_byte  := RByte,
  933:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
  934:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
  935:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  936:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  937:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  938:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  939:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  940:                                      Counters,
  941:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
  942:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
  943:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
  944:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
  945:                                       {read_tries,    any},
  946:                                       {write_tries,   any},
  947:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
  948:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
  949:                            catch
  950:                                C:E:S ->
  951:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
  952:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
  953:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
  954:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
  955:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
  956:                            end
  957:                    end},
  958:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
  959:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
  960:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
  961:                            ok
  962:                    end},
  963: 
  964:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 2)",
  965:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
  966:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
  967:                    end},
  968:          #{desc => "send (2)",
  969:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  970:                          send       := Send,
  971:                          write_pkg  := Pkg,
  972:                          write_byte := Byte} = State) ->
  973:                            Data = ?DATA,
  974:                            case Send(Sock, Data) of
  975:                                ok ->
  976:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
  977:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
  978:                                                write_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
  979:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
  980:                                    ERROR
  981:                            end
  982:                    end},
  983:          #{desc => "validate (send 2)",
  984:            cmd  => fun(#{csock      := Sock,
  985:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
  986:                          read_byte  := RByte,
  987:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
  988:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
  989:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
  990:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
  991:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
  992:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
  993:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
  994:                                      Counters,
  995:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
  996:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
  997:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
  998:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
  999:                                       {read_tries,    any},
 1000:                                       {write_tries,   any},
 1001:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
 1002:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
 1003:                            catch
 1004:                                C:E:S ->
 1005:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "

 1010:                            end
 1011:                    end},

 1013:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1014:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
 1015:                            ok
 1016:                    end},

 1025:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1026:                                    ERROR
 1027:                            end
 1028:                    end},

 1032:                            {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)}
 1033:                    end},

 1042:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)

 1047:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 1048:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)}
 1049:                    end},

 1530:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
 1531:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 1532:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
 1533:                            ok
 1534:                    end},
 1535:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 1536:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
 1537:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
 1538:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 1539:                            {ok, State1}
 1540:                    end},
 1541: 
 1542:          %% *** We are done ***
 1543:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1544:         ],
 1545: 
 1546:     i("start server evaluator"),
 1547:     ServerInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 1548:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 1549: 
 1550:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 1551:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 1552:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 1553: 
 1554:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 1555:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
 1556:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
 1557:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1558: 
 1559:     i("await evaluator"),
 1560:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
 1561: 
 1562: 
 1563: format_counters(Counters) ->
 1564:     format_counters(traffic, Counters).
 1565: 
 1566: format_counters(Type, Counters) when (Type =:= listen) orelse (Type =:= traffic) ->
 1567:     format_counters("   ", Type, Counters).
 1568: 
 1569: format_counters(Prefix, traffic, Counters) ->
 1570:     ReadByte    = maps:get(read_byte,     Counters, -1),
 1571:     ReadFails   = maps:get(read_fails,    Counters, -1),
 1572:     ReadPkg     = maps:get(read_pkg,      Counters, -1),
 1573:     ReadPkgMax  = maps:get(read_pkg_max,  Counters, -1),
 1574:     ReadTries   = maps:get(read_tries,    Counters, -1),
 1575:     ReadWaits   = maps:get(read_waits,    Counters, -1),
 1576:     WriteByte   = maps:get(write_byte,    Counters, -1),
 1577:     WriteFails  = maps:get(write_fails,   Counters, -1),
 1578:     WritePkg    = maps:get(write_pkg,     Counters, -1),
 1579:     WritePkgMax = maps:get(write_pkg_max, Counters, -1),
 1580:     WriteTries  = maps:get(write_tries,   Counters, -1),
 1581:     WriteWaits  = maps:get(write_waits,   Counters, -1),
 1582:     ?F("~n~sNumber Of Read Bytes:     ~p"
 1583:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Fails:     ~p"
 1584:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Packages:  ~p"
 1585:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Tries:     ~p"
 1586:        "~n~sNumber Of Read Waits:     ~p"
 1587:        "~n~sMax Read Package Size:    ~p"
 1588:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Bytes:    ~p"
 1589:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Fails:    ~p"
 1590:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Packages: ~p"
 1591:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Tries:    ~p"
 1592:        "~n~sNumber Of Write Waits:    ~p"
 1593:        "~n~sMax Write Package Size:   ~p",
 1594:        [Prefix, ReadByte,
 1595:         Prefix, ReadFails,
 1596:         Prefix, ReadPkg,
 1597:         Prefix, ReadTries,
 1598:         Prefix, ReadWaits,
 1599:         Prefix, ReadPkgMax,
 1600:         Prefix, WriteByte,
 1601:         Prefix, WriteFails,
 1602:         Prefix, WritePkg,
 1603:         Prefix, WriteTries,
 1604:         Prefix, WriteWaits,
 1605:         Prefix, WritePkgMax]);
 1606: 
 1607: format_counters(Prefix, listen, Counters) ->
 1608:     AccSuccess = maps:get(acc_success, Counters, -1),
 1609:     AccFails   = maps:get(acc_fails,   Counters, -1),
 1610:     AccTries   = maps:get(acc_tries,   Counters, -1),
 1611:     AccWaits   = maps:get(acc_waits,   Counters, -1),
 1612:     ?F("~n~sNumber Of Successful Accepts: ~p"
 1613:        "~n~sNumber Of Failed Accepts:     ~p"
 1614:        "~n~sNumber Of Accept Attempts:    ~p"
 1615:        "~n~sNumber Of Accept Waits:       ~p",
 1616:        [Prefix, AccSuccess,
 1617:         Prefix, AccFails,
 1618:         Prefix, AccTries,
 1619:         Prefix, AccWaits]).
 1620: 
 1621: all_counters() ->
 1622:     [
 1623:      read_byte,
 1624:      read_fails,
 1625:      read_pkg,
 1626:      read_pkg_max,
 1627:      read_tries,
 1628:      read_waits,
 1629:      write_byte,
 1630:      write_fails,
 1631:      write_pkg,
 1632:      write_pkg_max,
 1633:      write_tries,
 1634:      write_waits,
 1635:      acc_success,
 1636:      acc_fails,
 1637:      acc_tries,
 1638:      acc_waits
 1639:     ].
 1640: 
 1641: zero_counters() ->
 1642:     [{Cnt, 0} || Cnt <- all_counters()].
 1643: 
 1644: any_counters() ->
 1645:     [{Cnt, any} || Cnt <- all_counters()].
 1646: 
 1647: 
 1648: %% This function ensures that we have a list of "validate counters"
 1649: %% that have an entry for each existing counter.
 1650: 
 1651: ensure_counters(Counters) ->
 1652:     ensure_counters(any_counters(), Counters, []).
 1653: 
 1654: ensure_counters([], [], Acc) ->
 1655:     lists:reverse(Acc);
 1656: ensure_counters([{Cnt, Val}|DefCounters], Counters, Acc) ->
 1657:     case lists:keysearch(Cnt, 1, Counters) of
 1658:         {value, {Cnt, _} = T} ->
 1659:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
 1660:             ensure_counters(DefCounters, Counters2, [T|Acc]);
 1661:         false ->
 1662:             ensure_counters(DefCounters, Counters, [{Cnt, Val}|Acc])
 1663:     end.
 1664: 
 1665: traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters) ->
 1666:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation -> entry with"
 1667:     %%             "~n   Counters: ~p", [Counters]),
 1668:     traffic_sar_counters_validation2(maps:to_list(Counters),
 1669:                                      zero_counters()).
 1670: 
 1671: traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters, ValidateCounters) ->
 1672:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation -> entry with"
 1673:     %%             "~n   Counters:          ~p"
 1674:     %%             "~n   Validate Counters: ~p", [Counters, ValidateCounters]),
 1675:     traffic_sar_counters_validation2(maps:to_list(Counters),
 1676:                                      ensure_counters(ValidateCounters)).
 1677: 
 1678: traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters, []) ->
 1679:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> Remaining Counters: "
 1680:     %%             "~n   ~p", [Counters]),
 1681:     (catch lists:foreach(
 1682:              fun({_Cnt, 0})   -> ok;
 1683:                 ({Cnt,  Val}) ->
 1684:                      throw({error, {invalid_counter, Cnt, Val}})
 1685:              end,
 1686:              Counters));
 1687: traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters, [{Cnt, Val}|ValidateCounters]) ->
 1688:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> try validate ~w when"
 1689:     %%             "~n   Counters:         ~p"
 1690:     %%             "~n   ValidateCounters: ~p", [Cnt, Counters, ValidateCounters]),
 1691:     case lists:keysearch(Cnt, 1, Counters) of
 1692:         {value, {Cnt, Val}} ->
 1693:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> ~w validated", [Cnt]),
 1694:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
 1695:             traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters2, ValidateCounters);
 1696:         {value, {Cnt, _Val}} when (Val =:= any) ->
 1697:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
 1698:             %%             "~w validated (any) when"
 1699:             %%             "~n   Counters: ~p", [Cnt, Counters]),
 1700:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
 1701:             traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters2, ValidateCounters);
 1702:         {value, {Cnt, InvVal}} ->
 1703:             ?SEV_EPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
 1704:                         "~w validation failed: "
 1705:                         "~n   Expected Value: ~p"
 1706:                         "~n   Actual Value:   ~p", [Cnt, Val, InvVal]),
 1707:             {error, {invalid_counter, Cnt, InvVal, Val}};
 1708:         false ->
 1709:             ?SEV_EPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
 1710:                         "~w validation failed: Unknown", [Cnt]),
 1711:             {error, {unknown_counter, Cnt, Counters}}
 1712:     end.
 1713:

 1722: traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1723:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
 1724:     tc_try(traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp4,
 1725:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 1726:            fun() ->
 1727:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
 1728:                                  proto  => udp,
 1729:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
 1730:                                                    socket:recvfrom(S)
 1731:                                            end,
 1732:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
 1733:                                                    socket:sendto(S, Data, Dest)
 1734:                                            end},
 1735:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
 1736:            end).

 1794: traffic_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_counters_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->

 1800:                                  proto  => udp,

 1807:                                                            ERROR
 1808:                                                    end

 1811:                                                    Msg = #{addr => Dest,
 1812:                                                               iov  => [Data]},
 1813:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)
 1814:                                            end},

 1884: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1885: 
 1886: traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState) ->
 1887:     ServerSeq =
 1888:         [
 1889:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1890:          #{desc => "await start",
 1891:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1892:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1893:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1894:                    end},
 1895:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1896:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1897:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1898:                            ok
 1899:                    end},
 1900: 
 1901:          %% *** Init part ***
 1902:          #{desc => "which local address",
 1903:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 1904:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 1905:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 1906:                    end},
 1907:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1908:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
 1909:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, Proto) of
 1910:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1911:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1912:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1913:                                    ERROR
 1914:                            end
 1915:                    end},
 1916:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 1917:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 1918:                          sock     := Sock,
 1919:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
 1920:                            case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 1921:                                ok ->
 1922:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 1923:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1924:                                    ERROR
 1925:                            end;
 1926:                       (#{sock     := LSock,
 1927:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 1928:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 1929:                                ok ->
 1930:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 1931:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 1932:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1933:                                    ERROR
 1934:                            end
 1935:                    end},
 1936:          #{desc => "initial counter validation (=zero)",
 1937:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1938:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 1939:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
 1940:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial counters: "
 1941:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
 1942:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
 1943:                            catch
 1944:                                C:E:S ->
 1945:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 1946:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1947:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1948:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1949:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
 1950:                            end
 1951:                    end},
 1952:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1953:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 1954:                          tester   := Tester,
 1955:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}}) ->
 1956:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
 1957:                            ok;
 1958:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
 1959:                          lport    := Port}) ->
 1960:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
 1961:                            ok
 1962:                    end},
 1963: 
 1964:          %% The actual test
 1965:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
 1966:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1967:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
 1968:                    end},
 1969:          #{desc => "recv (1)",
 1970:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1971:                          recv := Recv} = State) ->
 1972:                            case Recv(Sock) of
 1973:                                {ok, {ClientSA, Data}} ->
 1974:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
 1975:                                    {ok, State#{client_sa => ClientSA,
 1976:                                                read_pkg  => 1,
 1977:                                                read_byte => size(Data)}};
 1978:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1979:                                    ERROR
 1980:                            end
 1981:                    end},
 1982:          #{desc => "validate (recv 1)",
 1983:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
 1984:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
 1985:                          read_byte := Byte} = _State) ->
 1986:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 1987:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
 1988:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
 1989:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
 1990:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
 1991:                                      Counters,
 1992:                                      [{read_pkg,   Pkg},
 1993:                                       {read_byte,  Byte},
 1994:                                       {read_tries, any}])
 1995:                            catch
 1996:                                C:E:S ->
 1997:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 1998:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1999:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 2000:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 2001:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
 2002:                            end
 2003:                    end},
 2004:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2005:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2006:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
 2007:                            ok
 2008:                    end},
 2009: 
 2010:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 1)",
 2011:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2012:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
 2013:                    end},
 2014:          #{desc => "send (1)",
 2015:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
 2016:                          send      := Send,
 2017:                          client_sa := ClientSA} = State) ->
 2018:                            Data = ?DATA,
 2019:                            case Send(Sock, Data, ClientSA) of
 2020:                                ok ->
 2021:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
 2022:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => 1,
 2023:                                                write_byte => size(Data)}};
 2024:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2025:                                    ERROR
 2026:                            end
 2027:                    end},
 2028:          #{desc => "validate (send 1)",
 2029:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
 2030:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
 2031:                          read_byte  := RByte,
 2032:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
 2033:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
 2034:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
 2035:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
 2036:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
 2037:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
 2038:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
 2039:                                      Counters,
 2040:                                      [{read_pkg,    RPkg},
 2041:                                       {read_byte,   RByte},
 2042:                                       {write_pkg,   SPkg},
 2043:                                       {write_byte,  SByte},
 2044:                                       {read_tries,  any},
 2045:                                       {write_tries, any}])
 2046:                            catch
 2047:                                C:E:S ->
 2048:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
 2049:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
 2050:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
 2051:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 2052:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
 2053:                            end
 2054:                    end},
 2055:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 1)",
 2056:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2057:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
 2058:                            ok
 2059:                    end},
 2060: 
 2061:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2062:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2063:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
 2064:                    end},
 2065:          #{desc => "recv (2)",
 2066:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
 2067:                          recv      := Recv,
 2068:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
 2069:                          read_byte := Byte} = State) ->
 2070:                            case Recv(Sock) of
 2071:                                {ok, {Source, Data}} ->
 2072:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
 2073:                                    {ok, State#{client_sa => Source,
 2074:                                                read_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
 2075:                                                read_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
 2076:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2077:                                    ERROR
 2078:                            end
 2079:                    end},
 2080:          #{desc => "validate (recv 2)",
 2081:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
 2082:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
 2083:                          read_byte  := RByte,
 2084:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
 2085:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
 2086:                            try socket:info(Sock) of

 2592:          #{desc => "await client ready (send_and_validate 1)",
 2593:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2594:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_and_validate)
 2595:                    end},
 2596:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2597:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2598:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_and_validate)
 2599:                    end},
 2600: 
 2601:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2602: 
 2603:          #{desc => "order client to continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2604:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2605:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, recv_and_validate),
 2606:                            ok
 2607:                    end},
 2608:          #{desc => "order server to continue (send_and_validate 1)",
 2609:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2610:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_and_validate),
 2611:                            ok
 2612:                    end},
 2613:          #{desc => "await server ready (send_and_validate 1)",
 2614:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2615:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_and_validate)
 2616:                    end},
 2617:          #{desc => "await client ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
 2618:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2619:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_and_validate)
 2620:                    end},
 2621: 
 2622:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2623: 
 2624:          #{desc => "order server to continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2625:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2626:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, recv_and_validate),
 2627:                            ok
 2628:                    end},
 2629:          #{desc => "order client to continue (send_and_validate 2)",
 2630:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2631:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_and_validate),
 2632:                            ok
 2633:                    end},
 2634:          #{desc => "await client ready (send_and_validate 2)",
 2635:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2636:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_and_validate)
 2637:                    end},
 2638:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2639:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2640:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_and_validate)
 2641:                    end},
 2642: 
 2643:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2644: 
 2645:          #{desc => "order client to continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2646:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2647:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, recv_and_validate),
 2648:                            ok
 2649:                    end},
 2650:          #{desc => "order server to continue (send_and_validate 2)",
 2651:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2652:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_and_validate),
 2653:                            ok
 2654:                    end},
 2655:          #{desc => "await server ready (send_and_validate 2)",
 2656:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2657:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_and_validate)
 2658:                    end},
 2659:          #{desc => "await client ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
 2660:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2661:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_and_validate)
 2662:                    end},
 2663: 
 2664:          %% *** Termination ***
 2665:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
 2666:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 2667:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
 2668:                            ok
 2669:                    end},
 2670:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 2671:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = State) ->
 2672:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
 2673:                            State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
 2674:                            {ok, State1}
 2675:                    end},
 2676:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
 2677:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 2678:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
 2679:                            ok
 2680:                    end},
 2681:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 2682:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
 2683:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
 2684:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 2685:                            {ok, State1}
 2686:                    end},
 2687: 
 2688:          %% *** We are done ***
 2689:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2690:         ],
 2691: 
 2692:     i("start server evaluator"),
 2693:     ServerInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 2694:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 2695: 
 2696:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 2697:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 2698:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 2699: 
 2700:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 2701:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
 2702:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
 2703:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 2704: 
 2705:     i("await evaluator"),
 2706:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
 2707:

 2712: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
 2713: %% behave as expected when sending and/or reading chunks.
 2714: %% First send data in one "big" chunk, and read it in "small" chunks.
 2715: %% Second, send in a bunch of "small" chunks, and read in one "big" chunk.
 2716: %% Protocol is tcp and Domain is IPv4.
 2717: 
 2718: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2719:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 2720:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2721:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 2722:            fun() ->
 2723:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
 2724:                                  proto  => tcp},
 2725:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState)
 2726:            end).

 2780:            end,

 2800:                    is_not_flakey_os(),
 2801:                    has_support_ipv6(),
 2802:                    has_support_sctp()
 2803:            end,
